column2: it was the Sunday afternoons he couldn’t cope with
column3: and that terrible listlessness that starts to set in about 2.55
column4: when you know you’ve had all the baths you can usefully have that day
column5: that however hard you stare at any given paragraph in the newspaper you will never actually read it
column6: or use the revolutionary new pruning technique it describes
column7: and that as you stare at the clock the hands will move relentlessly on to four o’clock
column8: and you will enter the long dark teatime of the soul.
